Method Detail

calculateMatrixSize

int calculateMatrixSize(java.lang.String data)
Determines the size of the data matrix we will need by reading the size of the string and calculating what the square root of that size is. This is the minimum width in pixels we can create a QRCode in. NOTE: this does not mean the image is that size. You will have to scale the image up or down to fit.

drawBlock

render

def render(java.lang.String data, java.lang.Long width)

render

def render(java.lang.String data, java.lang.Long width, java.lang.Long height)

render

def render(java.lang.String data, int width, int height)
Renders a String inside a QRCode in a RenderedImage object of the width and height you specify. The result CANNOT be smaller than one pixel per byte. That means if your data takes 30 bytes and you ask for a 16x16 image the renderer will ignore your scale requests and simply report the smallest image it possibly can. Choose square width and height please.

renderPng

void renderPng(java.lang.String data, int size, java.io.OutputStream outputStream)
Renders the data supplied in a QRCode of the pixel size (width == height) on the output stream you specify as a PNG.

renderPng

void renderPng(def response, java.lang.String data, int size)
